title: Students try to eliminate illegible handwriting with a book
snippet: During an Analysis lecture by teacher Georg Prokert, Lourens Touwen, a bachelor's student of Applied Mathematics, noticed that he had a lot of trouble deciphering his professor's handwriting on the chalkboard. With his fellow student Tristan Trouwen he joked that it would be a nice idea to make a book to practice mathematical symbols, like toddlers do with the letters of the alphabet. The ...

title: Lourens Touwen
snippet: A notebook containing the guide to writing mathematical symbols like you're in kindergarten. This was my COVID summer project with Tristan Trouwen. Fun article about the whole thing; Team HART, a university and industry funded team of ~18 students. We developed a sleeve that can give haptic feedback representing any type of information.
